001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003/**
004 * Enumeration of supported interpolation methods for interpolation of functions
005 * from discrete data points.
006 *
007 * <p>
008 * Each enum constant provides a method to create an {@link Interpolator}
009 * instance for the given x and y data points.
010 *
011 * @author Rob Challen
012 */
013public enum Interpolators {
014
015        /** Interpolator for monotone cubic spline interpolation. */
016        MONOTONIC_CUBIC_SPLINE,
017        /** Interpolator for cubic spline interpolation. */
018        CUBIC_SPLINE,
019        /** Interpolator for LOESS interpolation. */
020        LOESS,
021        /** Interpolator for linear interpolation. */
022        LINEAR;
023
024        private Interpolators() {}
025
026        /**
027         * Create an Interpolator instance for the given x and y data points using
028         * the interpolation method represented by this enum constant.
029         *
030         * @param x the x data points
031         * @param y the y data points corresponding to the x data points
032         * @return an Interpolator instance that can be used to interpolate values
033         *         based on the given data points and interpolation method
034         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if this enum constant does not correspond
035         *                                  to a known interpolation method
036         */
037        public Interpolator create(double[] x, double[] y) {
038                switch (this) {
039                case MONOTONIC_CUBIC_SPLINE:
040                        return SplineInterpolator.createMonotoneCubicSpline(x, y);
041                case CUBIC_SPLINE:
042                        return SplineInterpolator.createCubicSpline(x, y);
043                case LOESS:
044                        return LoessInterpolator.createLoessInterpolator(x, y);
045                case LINEAR:
046                        return LinearInterpolator.createLinearInterpolator(x, y);
047                default:
048                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown interpolator: " + this);
049                }
050        }
051
052}
